Node.definition: = man, also known as Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Jeshurun (יְשֻׁרוּן) including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of Isaac (יִצְחָק) and Rebekah (רִבְקָה) brother of Esau (עֵשָׂו) and ► father of twelve sons after whom the tribes of Israel were named and one daughter
= state in which humans or deities experience a feeling of affection for a person, an object, or a practice
= nation and their territory; ◄ regarded as founded by one of the sons of Ham (חָם) with the same name
literally: to cry out; hence: = causative action by which humans or deities let (other) humans know that they are to come, either by approaching them directly or sending a message
= direct or indirect human offspring, either male or indeterminate, either biologically or through adoption
literally: to cry out; hence: = causative action by which humans or deities let (other) humans know that they are to come, either by approaching them directly or sending a message
= action by which humans, deities, or animals move forward, usually towards a specific destination
= male deity; ► worshiped by Canaanites (כְּנַעֲנִי) ≈ regarded as the possessor of a certain location

= the human activity of killing one or more animals as a religious sacrifice; usually part of the animal is offered to the deity and part is eaten by the worshipers; often accompanied by the burning of incense
= a physical likeness or representation of a person, animal, or thing; ◄ carved out of wood and sometimes stone, ► and functioning as an object of non sanctioned worship
= causative action by which humans set alight and cause smoke to rise from the sacrificial fat parts of an animal, of grain and other offerings, including incense ► as an offering to a deity
= referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse
literally: to cause to move about; hence: = causative action by which humans teach young children to walk; ≈ used metaphorically about God teaching his people how to live
= reference to the northern kingdom of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) of which Ephraim was the most important tribe
= each of the two upper limbs of the body, including the shoulder and extending until the hand; ≈ directly associated with strength and power
= process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind

= causative action by which humans or deities help or cause (other) humans to be restored to health or physical strength after a disease or an accident; this could also refer to the wound or disease itself

= piece of stout cord; ◄ made by twisting together palm fibres, linen, or reeds; ► used for tying and keeping things together, climbing, measuring, drawing things to oneself, making traps, etc.; ≈ often used in a figurative sense to refer to conditions that try to take control of people; a rope tied around the head is a symbol of submission
= human being as an individual or as a class of living creatures; sometimes explicitly subdivided between male (זָכָר) and female (נְקֵבָה) ≈ associated with mortality
literally: to draw (people); hence: = pattern of actions by which a deity exercises leadership over humans, ◄ described with the image of someone drawing an animal with a rope
= piece of cord or chain; ◄ made by twisting together strands of palm fibres, linen, reeds, or gold; ► used for tying and keeping things together
= affection between people, or between people and deities
literally: to lift up (someone's) yoke; hence: = causative action by which deities ease the hardship of people

= bar or frame ◄ normally made of wood ► used to join two draft animals at the neck so that they can work together effectively in pulling a plow, threshing board, harrow, or wagon; ≈ often used in a figurative sense to denote oppression
jaw, cheek
= action by which humans or deities lean forward ► in order to reach out to those in need of their intervention

Node.gloss: to make (someone) eat|to give (someone) to eat
Node.definition: = action by which someone gives other people food for consumption, sometimes with the added connotation that these people are actually forced to consume it; with or without explicit object
literally: to turn; hence: = action by which animals, humans, or deities move back to a location where they have been before

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land
= nation and their territory; ◄ regarded as founded by one of the sons of Ham (חָם) with the same name
= nation; ◄ located in Northern Mesopotamia with Nineveh (נִינְוֵה) as its capital; regarded as descendants of Shem (שֵׁם)
= referent to a male person or another object that is considered masculine
= supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity
= state in which humans and deities are unwilling to assent to a suggestion or proposal
literally: to turn (to someone); hence: = action by which humans or deities associate with other humans or deities, often to look for or to provide help and support
= process by which an event takes place with force and violence ◄ compared to a whirlwind
= action by which humans are engaged in an armed conflict with other humans, accompanied by deeds of aggression

= relatively large and permanent population center, usually surrounded by a wall and surrounded by a number of dependent villages (חָצֵר) settlements (בַּת) and pasturelands (מִגְרָשׁ) ≈ associated with strength and security
literally: to finish; hence: = causative action by which humans or deities cause heavy damage to objects to the extent that they are almost gone

= state in which an object is an integrated part of a larger unit or substance|= long, slender piece of wood; ◄ made from a straight branch or tree; ► used for carrying objects or for locking gates from the inside|= person who speaks on behalf of a deity or other supernatural power; ≈ probably associated with foolishness
= action by which people or objects are removed from existence in a violent way ◄ as food that is eaten
= action by which humans exercise their minds to determine how they are going to achieve a particular purpose
= process by which people turning away from someone they had pledged to serve
literally: to cry out; hence: = causative action by which humans or deities let (other) humans know that they are to come, either by approaching them directly or sending a message
= marker reinforcing that an event is definitely not happening
literally: to lift up (someone's) yoke; hence: = causative action by which deities ease the hardship of people

= referent to the way in which an event is performed; ► normally with the intention of finding out how, but often used in rhetorical questions in order to express one's conviction that that event in question cannot be performed at all (under the given circumstances)
= reference to the northern kingdom of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) of which Ephraim was the most important tribe

Node.gloss: to give up|to hand over|to abandon
Node.definition: literally: to give (up); hence: = action by which deities suspend their commitment to humans, either temporarily or permanently

= man, also known as Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Jeshurun (יְשֻׁרוּן) including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of Isaac (יִצְחָק) and Rebekah (רִבְקָה) brother of Esau (עֵשָׂו) and ► father of twelve sons after whom the tribes of Israel were named and one daughter

= referent to the way in which an event is performed; ► normally with the intention of finding out how, but often used in rhetorical questions in order to express one's conviction that that event in question cannot be performed at all (under the given circumstances)
= town; ◄ located near Dead Sea (יָם־הַמֶּלַח) ► destroyed with Sodom (סְדֹם) and Gomorrah (עֲמֹרָה)
= causative action by which humans or deities make objects or (other) humans different from what they were before
= town; ◄ located near Dead Sea (יָם־הַמֶּלַח) ► destroyed with Sodom (סְדֹם) and Gomorrah (עֲמֹרָה)
= process by which events take on a different nature
literally: heart; hence: = the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief
= state in which multiple events are connected
literally: to be, become warm; hence: = state/process by which an event becomes active
= state in which deities experience a desire to make humans feel relief after a time of grief

Node.gloss: to do|to perform|to commit|to practice|to observe|to celebrate|to keep
Node.definition: = action by which humans or deities engage in a particular action
literally: kindling of anger; hence: = process by which the anger (אַף) of deities is aroused ◄ like a fire that is kindled
= state of extreme displeasure; ≈ often associated with fire and smoke
= reference to the northern kingdom of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) of which Ephraim was the most important tribe
with singular meaning: = the highest God, creator of heaven and earth
= referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse

= state in which a deity differs from humans and other deities in that he cannot be associated with anything that is in any way profane or tainted by sin or other impurities, which is a quality that he desires to see in everything else as well
= state in which humans or deities are deeply upset ◄ which may have different causes ► and may therefore express itself in different ways, such as anger, fear, etc.
= particle linking two elements and indicating that X is committed to follow Y's leadership and example
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= process by which humans or deities follow a certain pattern of behavior, ◄ which is described as their journey through life

= the largest of the great cats, often being about 2.8 meters from nose to tip of tail, standing as high as 1 meter (3 feet 3 inches) at the shoulder; pale yellowish brown in color; around the neck and shoulders of adult males grows a mane that is darker than the rest of their fur; ◄ Panthera leo; ► unclean animal; ≈ associated with aggression, fearlessness, and respect
= action by which animals, humans, or deities produce a full, deep, prolonged sound as made by a lion; ≈ associated with aggression, but also with suffering
= referent to a male person or another object that is considered masculine
= action by which animals, humans, or deities produce a full, deep, prolonged sound as made by a lion; ≈ associated with aggression, but also with suffering
= state/process by which humans experience a strong fear, usually accompanied by shaking and trembling
= direct or indirect human offspring, either male or indeterminate, either biologically or through adoption
literally: the sea; = a cardinal direction pointing towards the west, ◄ which, in Israel, is the direction towards the Mediterranean Sea
= state/process by which humans experience a strong fear, usually accompanied by shaking and trembling

= small bird, speckled brown in color; found in abundance around towns and settlements; lives on grass and grain; ◄ Passer domesticus, Passer hispaniolensis, and Passer moabiticus; ► clean and can therefore be eaten
= nation and their territory; ◄ regarded as founded by one of the sons of Ham (חָם) with the same name

= a bird with a blue gray color with a pinkish sheen to the neck feathers and a black tip on its tail; lives in large colonies and eats mainly seeds; courts, mates, and has nests several times a year; nests on rock ledges; ◄ |iColumba livia|i*; ► used as food and for sacrifices; ≈ regarded as swift, docile, and innocent, but also as silly and senseless; associated with affection, fertility and sexuality because of its mating habits; the moaning sound this bird sometimes makes is associated with pain and suffering

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land
= nation; ◄ located in Northern Mesopotamia with Nineveh (נִינְוֵה) as its capital; regarded as descendants of Shem (שֵׁם)
= causative action by which humans or deities cause (other) humans to make a certain place or area their home
literally: house; hence: = a group of people associated with a house, such as the family living there, or the descendants of the head of the household
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
